title: The Ten Commandments
description: Moses, an Egyptian Prince, learns of his true heritage as a Hebrew and his divine mission as the deliverer of his people.

title: Around the World in 80 Days
oscars_won_details: Best Music, Scoring of a Dramatic or Comedy Picture
description: A Victorian Englishman bets that with the new steamships and railways he can circumnavigate the globe in eighty days.

title: Giant
description: Sprawling epic covering the life of a Texas cattle rancher and his family and their rivalry with a cowboy and eventual oil tycoon.

title: The King and I
oscars_won_details: Best Music, Scoring of a Musical Picture
description: A widow accepts a job as a live-in governess to the King of Siam's children.

title: The Searchers
description: An American Civil War veteran embarks on a journey to rescue his niece from the Comanches.

title: Invasion of the Body Snatchers
description: A small-town doctor learns that the population of his community is being replaced by emotionless alien duplicates.

title: Forbidden Planet
description: A starship crew goes to investigate the silence of a planet's colony only to find two survivors and a deadly secret that one of them has.

title: Written on the Wind
oscars_won_details: Best Actress in a Supporting Role
description: A dipsomaniac playboy and his nymphomaniac sister destroy the lives of the people around them in this Technicolor melodrama.

title: The Killing
description: A career criminal recruits a team of small-time crooks to pull off one last big heist at a racetrack.

title: Bigger Than Life
description: A seriously ill school teacher becomes dependent on a miracle drug that begins to affect his sanity.

title: Baby Doll
description: A child bride holds her husband at bay while a rival cotton gin owner tries to seduce her.

title: Lust for Life
oscars_won_details: Best Actor in a Supporting Role
description: The life of brilliant but tortured artist Vincent van Gogh.

title: Friendly Persuasion
description: A peaceful Quaker family is forced to deal with the violence of the Civil War.

title: Anastasia
description: An opportunistic Russian businessman tries to pass an impostor as the Grand Duchess Anastasia.

title: Bus Stop
description: A naive but stubborn cowboy falls in love with a saloon singer and tries to take her away to his ranch in Montana.

title: High Society
description: A spoiled heiress, Tracy Lord, must choose between three men: her ex-husband, a famous jazz musician, and a reporter.

title: The Man Who Knew Too Much
description: An American family vacationing in Morocco stumbles onto an assassination plot and the conspirators are determined to prevent them from interfering.

title: The Wrong Man
description: A musician is mistaken for a vicious robber, and his wife's mental state deteriorates as his world collapses.

title: War and Peace
description: Napoleon's tumultuous relations with Russia, including his disastrous 1812 invasion, serve as the backdrop for the tangled personal lives of two aristocratic families.

title: Moby Dick
description: The sole survivor of a lost whaling ship relates the tale of his captain's self-destructive obsession to hunt the white whale, Moby Dick.

title: The Bad Seed
description: A housewife suspects that her seemingly perfect eight-year-old daughter is a heartless killer.

title: Tea and Sympathy
description: A sensitive young student at a boarding school is bullied for not being 'manly' enough, but finds understanding from the housemaster's wife.

title: Carousel
description: A carnival barker returns from heaven to make amends to his wife and daughter.

title: Trapeze
description: A crippled former aerialist mentors a young man to achieve the triple somersault on the trapeze.

title: The Rainmaker
description: During the Depression era, a con man brings hope and romance to a spinster in a drought-stricken western town.

title: The Teahouse of the August Moon
description: In post-WWII Japan, an American captain is sent to an Okinawan village to teach the natives democracy, but they teach him a thing or two instead.

title: The Eddy Duchin Story
description: The tragic life of pianist and bandleader Eddy Duchin, who rose to fame in the 1930s.

title: Somebody Up There Likes Me
description: The story of Rocky Graziano's rise from a juvenile delinquent to Middleweight Champion of the World.

title: The Solid Gold Cadillac
description: A minority stockholder in a large corporation manages to overturn the corrupt board of directors.

title: The Girl Can't Help It
description: A gangster hires a press agent to make his girlfriend a singing star, but the agent falls in love with her.

title: Love Me Tender
description: A Confederate team is ordered to rob a Union payroll train but the war ends just after the robbery. They take the money and hide out.

title: The Harder They Fall
description: A down-on-his-luck sportswriter is hired by a shady promoter to promote a giant but talentless boxer.

title: A Man Escaped
description: A French Resistance activist is imprisoned by the Nazis and devotes his waking hours to planning an elaborate escape.

title: Bob le Flambeur
description: An old gangster and gambler plans to rob a casino in Deauville.

title: Aparajito
description: Apu and his family move from their village in Bengal to Varanasi.

title: The Burmese Harp
description: In the closing days of WWII, a Japanese soldier fails to get his countrymen to surrender to overwhelming force and adopts the lifestyle of a Buddhist monk.

title: Seven Men from Now
description: A former sheriff blames himself for his wife's death during a Wells Fargo robbery and vows to track down and kill the seven men responsible.

title: Jubal
description: A Wyoming rancher's wife takes a liking to a new cowhand, which causes trouble with the ranch foreman.

title: Attack
description: A coward command officer causes the death of his men and the destruction of his unit.

title: Patterns
description: Fred Staples is recruited by a ruthless CEO to eventually replace a beloved but aging vice president, leading to a moral conflict.

title: While the City Sleeps
description: Reporters compete to catch the "Lipstick Killer" while power plays ensue at a newspaper conglomerate.

title: Beyond a Reasonable Doubt
description: A writer attempts to prove the inadequacies of circumstantial evidence by framing himself for a murder.

title: The Catered Affair
description: An Irish cabby in the Bronx watches his wife go overboard planning their daughter's wedding.

title: The Swan
description: A princess is urged by her mother to marry her cousin, a crown prince, but she is attracted to the family tutor.

title: Earth vs. the Flying Saucers
description: Extraterrestrials in flying saucers contact a scientist as part of a plan to enslave the inhabitants of Earth.
In a totalitarian future society, a man whose daily work is rewriting history tries to rebel by falling in love.

title: Battle of the River Plate
description: In the early months of World War II, the British Navy hunts down the powerful German battleship Graf Spee.

title: Helen of Troy
description: The classic story of the Spartan queen whose elopement with the Prince of Troy sparks a decade-long war.

title: A Kiss Before Dying
description: A ruthless college student resorts to murder in an attempt to marry an heiress.
